intro: Faroa minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered faroa, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest understorey. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
